dataModel.description: The bioregion in which the assessment unit is located.
dataModel.name: bioregion

dataModel.description: The code for the regional ecosystem (RE) in which the assessment unit is located.
dataModel.name: regionalEcosystem

dataModel.description: The name of the property in which the assessment unit is situated.
dataModel.name: property

dataModel.description: The compass bearing of the 100m transect and long axis of the 100x50m assessment plot.
dataModel.name: transectBearing

dataModel.description: The area in hectares of the the patch of vegetation in which this assessment unit occurs.
dataModel.name: patchArea

dataModel.description: General description of the assessment area.
dataModel.name: assessmentSiteDescription

dataModel.description: Upload photo(s) of the assessed area.
dataModel.name: image

dataModel.description: Count the number of living large eucalypt trees within the 100x50m area. Large trees are defined as having a DBH greater than the DBH threshold provided in the benchmark document.
dataModel.name: numLargeEucalypt

dataModel.description: Count the number of living large non-eucalypt trees within the 100x50m area.
dataModel.name: numLargeNonEucalypt

dataModel.description: The number of eucalypt large trees multiplied by 2 to give a per hectare figure.
dataModel.name: numLargeEucalyptPerHa

dataModel.description: The number of non-eucalypt large trees multiplied by 2 to give a per hectare figure.
dataModel.name: numLargeNonEucalyptPerHa

dataModel.description: Calculated score for large trees.
dataModel.name: largeTreesScore

dataModel.description: Calculated canopy height score as an average of individual layer scores >0.
dataModel.name: aveCanopyHeightScore

dataModel.description: The proportion of dominant species present at a site that are regenerating, i.e. having individuals with a DBH <5 cm.
dataModel.name: proportionDominantCanopySpeciesWithEvidenceOfRecruitment

dataModel.description: Calculated recruitment score for all species in the EDL with evidence of recruitment.
dataModel.name: edlRecruitmentScore

columns.description: List the names of all native tree species which can be identified in the 100x50m area.
columns.name: speciesNameTree

dataModel.description: Enter the number of native tree species in the 100x50m area which cannot be identified.
dataModel.name: numUnknownTreeSpecies

dataModel.description: Count of the total number of different species of native trees within the 100x50m plot area, not just EDL species. Trees are defined as single-stemmed plants >2m height.
dataModel.name: totalTreeSpeciesRichness

columns.description: List the names of all native shrub species which can be identified in the 50x10m area.
columns.name: speciesNameShrub

dataModel.description: Enter the number of native shrub species in the 50x10m area which cannot be identified.
dataModel.name: numUnknownShrubSpecies

dataModel.description: Count of the total number of different species of native shrubs within the 50x10m plot area.
dataModel.name: numShrubSpeciesTotal

columns.description: List the names of all native grass species which can be identified in the 50x10m area.
columns.name: speciesNameGrass

columns.description: List the names of all native species of forbs and other life forms which can be identified in the 50x10m area.
columns.name: speciesNameForb

columns.description: List the names of all non-native species which can be identified in the 50x10m area.
columns.name: speciesNameNonNative

dataModel.description: Estimated percentage cover of the total vegetation cover that is comprised of exotic and non-indigenous species, assessed within the 50 x 10 m sub-plot.
dataModel.name: nonNativePlantCoverPercent

dataModel.description: Calculated score for vegetation cover that is comprised of exotic and non-indigenous species.
dataModel.name: nonNativePlantCoverScore

dataModel.description: Calculated score for coarse woody debris.
dataModel.name: cwdScore

dataModel.description: Calculated score for native tree canopy cover.
dataModel.name: treeCanopyCoverScoreAve

dataModel.description: Calculated score for native shrub canopy cover.
dataModel.name: shrubCanopyCoverScoreN
patchSize
constraints: ≥25 – 100 ha remnant OR ≥25 – 200 ha remnant and regrowth OR ≥25 – 200 ha regrowth
≥100 – 200 ha remnant OR >200 ha remnant and regrowth OR >200 ha regrowth

dataModel.name: connectivity
constraints: Low - The assessment unit is not connected using any of the below descriptions
Medium - The assessment unit is connected with adjacent remnant vegetation along > 10% to < 50% of its perimeter
Medium - The assessment unit is connected with adjacent remnant vegetation along < 10% of its perimeter AND is connected with adjacent regrowth native vegetation > 25% of its perimeter
High - The assessment unit is connected with adjacent remnant vegetation along 50% to 75% of its perimeter
Very high - The assessment unit is connected with adjacent remnant vegetation along > 75% of its perimeter
Very high - The assessment unit includes > 500 ha remnant vegetation

dataModel.name: landscapeContext
constraints: Low - < 10% remnant vegetation AND < 30% native non-remnant vegetation (regrowth)
Medium - >= 10% to 30% remnant vegetation AND < 30% regrowth
High - >= 10% to 30% remnant vegetation AND >= 30% regrowth

dataModel.name: distanceFromWater
constraints: 500 m to 1 km from water point
1 km to 3 km from water point
3 km to 5 km from water point

items.source:
Regional ecosystem benchmark values

Please enter the published benchmark values which are applicable to the selected regional ecosystem. These values are required for the calculation of scores.
If a particular value is not applicable for the selected RE, leave the value as '0'.

items.source: The number of native grass species is combined with the total number of other native plant life forms present to calculate a total native plant species richness score.

columns.title: Native forb species and other life form names

items.preLabel: Number of unknown native forbs & other species:
Total richness of native forbs & other species:

items.source: The number of native forbs and other species is combined with the total number of other native plant life forms present to calculate a total native plant species richness score.
Non-native plant species richness is recorded, but is not included in condition score calculations.

50 x 20m area - Coarse Woody Debris

Includes all logs > 10cm diameter and > 0.5m length (and >80% contact with the ground), within the boundary of the 50 x 20m plot area.

items.preLabel: Total length of coarse woody debris (m):

items.source:
Five 1x1m plots - Ground Cover

* attributes are essential to assess as used in scoring, however assessment of all attributes improves your ability to more accurately visualise proportions on each of the attributes)

Tree canopy cover
Estimate of the length of vertically projected foliage cover (over the 100 m transect) of the species making up the EDL or tree canopy cover, if applicable for the RE. Canopy cover equates to crown cover as defined by Walker and Hopkins (1990).
(Only assess Emergent (E) or Subcanopy (S) layers if the RE benchmark document stipulates that layers are present.) *If trees are in the same layer and continuous along the transect you can group them
Note: Only the projected foliage cover for native species is included in the calculated score.
Note: Only the projected foliage cover for native species is included in the calculated score.
